Here is a URL for the paper that the New Scientist article was based on.  How's that for a quick reponse :) ...




 Dear Colin:

  The paper will appear in the Physical Review Letters.
  An online version is available at:

  http://scitation.aip.org/dbt/dbt.jsp?KEY=PRLTAO&Volume=92&Issue=19#MINOR10

  Look for:

   Self-Sustained Activity in a Small-World Network of Excitable Neurons
   Alex Roxin, Hermann Riecke, and Sara A. Solla
   Published 11 May 2004 
   198101   Abstract   Full Text: [ PDF (969 kB)  GZipped PS Order Document ]

   Thanks for your interest,

   Sara A. Solla
   Northwestern University
   solla at northwestern.edu

 | 
 | Hi,
 | 
 | This weeks article in New Scientist regarding your research on short 
 | term memory has been raised in an artifical neural net discussion forum  
 | (at http://groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/ ).  I'd be interested in finding 
 | out a little more information but I have been unable to find the source 
 | of the article. Is there perhaps a recently published paper or journal 
 | with more information?
 | 
 | Thanks in advance for your time,
 | 
 | Regards,
 | 
 | Colin Green.
 |
